body.name: Cooler Master MasterAccessory Vertical GPU Card Holder Kit V3 Black, Premium Riser Cable PCI-E 4.0 x16-165mm, PCIe 3.0 Compatible, Adjustable Length for E-ATX|ATX|Micro ATX Case (MCA-U000R-KFVK03)

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 7 hrs 1 min
features: Cooler Master Riser Cable PCIe 4.0 Included: Allows for efficient data transmission and connectivity between the latest hardware components.
Effortlessly Showcase Your Graphics Card: Bring the best out of your components by showing off your GPU.
ATX & mATX Compatibility: Designed for both ATX and mATX cases, this accessory is compatible with the latest GPUs available on the market.
Toolless, Instantly Adjustable Design: Toollessly adjustable up to 65mm horizontally, as well as up to 30mm towards the side panel.
Premium Materials, 42% Increased Durability: Premium SGCC steel provides reliable support, eliminating possibilities of sagging or deformation.
body.description: Give your chassis an instant makeover with Cooler Master’s Vertical Graphics Card Holder Kit V3! Supporting cases ranging in size from mATX to ATX, this remastered design allows unprecedented compatibility with various builds and setups. A PCIe 4.0 riser cable is included to assist the installation process and ensure high efficiency at uncompromised speeds. The GPU bracket can be toollessly adjusted up to 65mm towards the front panel, as well as up to 30mm towards the side panel for greater compatibility and flexibility during use.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Make It Yours We're all about the things that make building a PC such a rewarding experience. The sense of achievement. The joy of making and creating something uniquely yours in form and function and, of course, the thrill of bringing your creation to life without melting your components. Universal Vertical Graphics Card Holder Kit V3 Make Of It What You Will Supporting cases ranging in size from mATX to ATX, this remastered design allows unprecedented compatibility with various builds and setups. A PCIe 4.0 riser cable is included to assist the installation process and ensure high efficiency at uncompromised speeds. The GPU bracket can be toollessly adjusted up to 65mm towards the front panel, as well as up to 30mm towards the side panel for greater compatibility and flexibility during use. Riser Cable PCIe 4.0 Effortlessly Showcase Your Graphics Card ATX & M-ATX Compatibility Toolless, Instantly Adjustable Design Premium Materials, 42% Increased Durability Intuitive Installation Process GPU Holder kit: 249x148.1x141.8mm (close) 305x178.1x141.8mm (open) Riser Cable: 165mm (6.49in)

Toolless, Adjustable Toolless, Instantly Adjustable Design up to 65mm horizontally, as well as up to 30mm towards the side panel. Intuitive Installation The modular design allows GPUs to placed in the system after the holder has been fixed in a preferred layout. Installation process is thus more intuitive and simplified, especially in tight M-ATX builds. Premium Materials Premium SGCC steel provides 42% increased durability and reliable support, eliminating possibilities of sagging or deformation. Protective ABS Casing UV resistant ABS casing protects cable connection points from rough handling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid replacement for the Lian Li PC-011D-XL variant
reviews.reviewText: I highly recommend this GPU holder, next to no questions asked.Bracket, Support & Positioning:VERY intuitive installation overall. Documentation is picture-based and easy to follow. I would consider this beginner-friendly and a great alternative to something from Antec, etc. As a general rule of thumb, familiarise yourself with the bracket before inserting your GPU - I was able to attach the bracket to the case, insert my GPU into the 2nd piece, and then slide the 2nd piece into the main bracket before securing. Very quick and in my opinion, easy to do.It also allows you to slide and position the GPU where you want it (i.e. more left or right, and more forwards or back). This was something unique from my original Lian Li bracket where my GPU was nearly forced againist the glass once I was able to get the dang thing in (more notes below on that). It supports my card exactly as I expect it to.Riser Cable & GPU Cabling:I was happy that this included the updated 4.0 cable as I don't have to perform witchcraft in my BIOS. It has some good length on it, while also being sturdy yet flexible. I'm very happy with it and the ease of installation itself was easy.For the power cables to the GPU, I did have to pull it out and extend to rotate around. If using a non-modular PSU and depending on your case, you will have to clean up your cable management if your power cable is not long enough. Do note that, case-depending, you will have a recess on the back of your case. This is normal and I found to be most welcome for a multitude of reasons that might be due to personal preference. Part of the back panel is also removable, which the instructions include as well.Packaging:Arrived securely and well-packaged. Bracket and sub-bracket were wrapped safely so no pre-assembly dings.Notes for clarity:I previously purchased the one specifically for my case (Lian Li PC-011D-XL) (the 3.0 variant) and it was ridiculously complicated / warped. I bought it again from another local store just in case and STILL had issues with it. I love my case but this has been a pain for a long time.This was installed on an E-ATX case and attached to an ATX motherboard, with a fully modular PSU that included pre-extended cabling. There are no cons because honestly, it works perfectly, even at this price point because you want quality for an expensive component. I'm not waiting in a 12 hour line again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works in mATX fine
reviews.reviewText: Solid GPU mount that works in a mATX case. It left just enough room below for mounting my fans to help cool the GPU. My only gripe with it is that the PCIE cable is very stiff and pretty long. I had to use some heat to make bends in the cable so it didn't push too hard on the PCIE slot or mount. Plenty of adjustments to make everything work, though I needed to ziptie the back of the mount to the case as the PCIE was pushing it towards the side glass.Overall I'm happy with it as something that is wholly unnecessary for a PC build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty great very adjustable, and supports the weight well.
reviews.reviewText: This vertical mount is pretty great and is very adjustable, it supports the weight of my 4090 liquid cooled fairly well, it adds a decent look to the case. It should work in any case you can fit it in. Temps didn't change much even being close to the front panel. It may not fully support the weight of a massive 3 slot card but it seems very sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can cause problems if GPU needs the bandwidth of PCIe 4.0 (RTX 30 series cards)
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to install a 3080 Ti into a Lian Li o11 dynamic case. The card is just barely too wide with common power supply connectors and results in you not being able to use the side panel on my specific case. One of the commenters on this product page did say it worked with the 3080 and 3090, so I figured I should be safe. It took about 10 minutes to install and be running.After 6 months, I started to experience system crashes with no discernible data in the event viewer to identify the cause. I would frequently see a critical error indicating failure to even write a memory dump. After a day of just crashes after every 30 minutes, I did manage to actually get a blue screen of death that said "VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE". This lead me to a ton of research and landing on a post on some community where the user indicated they had a vertical GPU mount and it was the cause.Sure enough, I replace the vertical mount and inserted the card normally, leaving the side panel off, and did not encounter any more crashes since. I did understood that my card and the slot on the motherboard worked with PCI 4.0. There might have been a setting in the bios to force the slot to also just be 3.0 at the cost of performance, but I decided to just play it safe. I am now just running my machine without the side panel and looking for low profile PCIe 6+2/8 pin, 90 degree adapters to see if I can force the connections down and have enough space to still use the side panel. I am also checking for decent rated and reviewed vertical mounts for PCI 4.0 cards too.I do not have the data to know if there are any additional issues that can be attributed to the reviewed product, but the issue I encountered was due to me not having the proper product for the devices I use, therefore I am not going to dock points on that. Shipping is irrelevant to the product, but it came on time and without any breaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very nice vertical gpu mount. Quality product and not very hard to install. I used it on a gigabyte 4070 and its stable and looks very cool.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: With all the new graphics cards being huge, many companies that build the rig for you won't ship the card installed due to its weight. I didn't want the card to weigh the motherboard down and this solution is perfect. It uses the case to hold the weight and even slides around to make room as needed. Bit of a squeeze with the cable to connect to the PCIe slot, but once it's in its does it job wonderfully.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Funcionó bien al inicio pero después de 2 días presento fallas
reviews.reviewText: Lastimosamente me lleve una mala experiencia con este soporte ya que al tener la gráfica montada en esta luego de dos días me dio fallas no me daba video, desconecte la gráfica y la puse directo a la board y no me presento ningún error, vuelvo y la monto con el soporte y me presento el mismo problema, a mi parecer creo que salió defectuoso el extensor pedí mi garantía y a día de hoy no me han solucionado nada, me pidieron que según venían por mi paquete para devolución de DHL pero aún no ha pasado nada, luego disque me contactara con la marca "Cooler Master" pero me parece una total pérdida de tiempo ya que esta empresa no es la vendedora por lo tanto no se me es posible tener una solución pronta, no me han reembolsado ni nada, dinero perdido

reviews.reviewerName: Funiona perfectamente Rtx 4070ti, lastima gabinetes se quedaron pequeños con estas Gpus, instalado en un Lian Li 11 dynamic.Funiona perfectamente Rtx 4070ti, lastima gabinetes se quedaron pequeños con estas Gpus, instalado en un Lian Li 11 dynamic.
reviews.reviewText: Permite acomodar Gpu en vertical, por lo cual ya puedo cerrar mi gabinete ya que habia quedado pequeño para Rtx 4070ti
fits good and very fold-able for tight spots!
Works great. Hold 4080 card with water block straight and I was able to fit it well in my corsair 760t case.
Excelente producto, cumple muy bien su función para instalar las GPUs en modo vertical, lucen muy bien algunos modelos de GPU con este soporte.

Der vertikale Montageadapter, der angeblich universell sein sollte, passte dennoch nicht in das PC-Gehäuse des NZXT H9. Ich musste ihn etwas modifizieren, damit er passt. Das Riser-Kabel, das dem PCIe 4.0-Standard entsprechen sollte, entsprach leider nicht der Beschreibung und verursachte viele Probleme. Mein Computer stürzte immer wieder ab, die Temperatur war nicht das Problem, sondern ich musste im BIOS PCIe auf GEN 3 einstellen.
